text: City of Industry is one of two gassers sharing the name.Davis, Larry. Gasser Wars (Cartech, 2003), pp.180-8. The first car named City of Industry was a Cadillac-powered 1953 Kurtis. It won the NHRA national titles in A/SP (A Production) at Oklahoma City, Oklahoma in 1958 (with a pass of 12.17 seconds at ),Davis, p.180. AM/SP (A Modified Production) at Detroit Dragway in 1960 (with a pass of 12.29 seconds at ), and at Indianapolis Raceway Park in 1961 (with a pass of 11.91 seconds at ) and 1962 (with a pass of 12.53 seconds at ).Davis, pp.180-3. The second was a Cadillac-powered 1963 Kurtis. It won the national AAM/SP (A Modified Production supercharged) title at Indianapolis Raceway Park in 1964 with a 10.62/ pass.Davis, p.184. Both were driven by Sam Parriott throughout their racing careers.Davis, pp.180-4. ==Notes== ==Sources== *Davis, Larry. Gasser Wars, North Branch, MN: Cartech, 2003, pp. 180–8. ==See also== * Cadillac High Technology engine Category:1950s cars Category:1960s cars Category:Drag racing cars Category:Rear-wheel-drive vehicles
title: City of Industry (car)
